page.title: 16CONSERVATION IN TARRANT
page.content: Our block which is part of the Tarrant Valley is an area of great beauty as is most of Dorset.To make sure it is not spoilt much of it has been made into Conservation areas.Some say the nearby town of Blandford Forum built in Georgian times has been spoilt by too many new houses,factories and a by-pass road so it is important that the villages of Tarrant Hinton, Launceston and Monkton are not altered too much. Hardly any new buildings are allowed and if you do build one it must be like the ones already there.Some people we talked to wanted to add parts to their cottages or build garages but they were not allowed to. I hope the villages will look as pretty as they do now in 500 years time.
